Class Deck

extends java.lang.Object

      • addCard

        protected Deck addCard(int suit,
                       int value)
        Add a newly instantiated Card to this deck.
        Parameters:
        suit - the suit of the new card
        value - the face value of the new card
        Returns:
        this instance, suitable for fluent-style programming.

      • addFace

        protected Deck addFace(Card card,
                       Deck.Face face)
        Adds a Deck.Face object associated with a specific card to the internal Face map. Consistent with Java maps, if the reference already exists it will be replaced.

        This method is protected, so only derived sub-classes can add a face reference.

        Parameters:
        card - the reference card
        face - the Deck.Face object to be associated with the reference card.
        Returns:
        this instance, suitable for fluent-style programming.

      • getFace

        public Deck.Face getFace(Card card)
        Gets the Deck.Face object associated with the reference card
        Parameters:
        card - the reference card
        Returns:
        the associated Deck.Face object

      • shuffle

        public void shuffle()
        Shuffles the deck by sorting the deck first by owner and then by assigned random number. This will have the effect of shuffling all the cards in the deck, but those owned by the deck (i.e. owned by 0) will be first in line and those which are discarded will (probably) be at the end of the list. It acts by calling the shuffleCustom(Comparator) method which has the effect of resetting all the random numbers before sorting.

      • shuffleCustom

        public void shuffleCustom(java.util.Comparator<Card> comparator)
        Shuffles the deck in a custom manner. The caller provides a Comparator object that will be applied before comparing the cards by their random number. Thus it is possible, for example, to shuffle the deck but group all the cards by suit, or by owner (as shuffle() does).
        Parameters:
        comparator - the custom Comparator

      • reset

        public void reset()
        resets the owner of all cards to 0 (the deck) and shuffles

      • dealCardTo

        public Card dealCardTo(int playerNum)
        Deal a card to a player
        Parameters:
        playerNum - a non-zero integer value representing a single player who will receive the card
        Returns:
        the Card dealt, or null if there are no remaining cards owned by the deck.

      • dealCardToPlayerBySuit

        public Card dealCardToPlayerBySuit(int playerNum,
                                   int suit)
        Deal a card to a player by suit.
        Parameters:
        playerNum - a non-zero integer value representing a single player who will receive the card
        suit - the suit requested
        Returns:
        the first undealt card from the card list which matches the requested suit.

      • discard

        public Deck discard(Card card)
        Discard a card. Simply sets the owner of the card to DISCARD and sets the random value to the current time in milliseconds. Because the random value is reset on every discard, the most recently discarded card can be retrieved by getting all the cards owned by DISCARD, sorting the list in reverse by Card.getRandom(), and taking the first card in the list.
        Parameters:
        card - the card being discarded.
        Returns:
        the Deck object, suitable for fluent-style programming.

      • burnCard

        public Card burnCard()
        Discards the first available card on the deck.
        Returns:
        the =Card burned, or null if there are not any undealt cards.

      • getDiscards

        public java.util.List<Card> getDiscards()
        Returns:
        a List of all "discarded" cards in the deck, sorted in reverse chronological order

      • dealNewHandToPlayer

        public java.util.List<Card> dealNewHandToPlayer(int playerNum,
                                                int numCardsInHand)
        Deal a new hand to a player, by simply finding the first numCardsInHand number of cards in the card list owned by the deck and changing the owner to the new player.

        It is not anticipated that the player would have an existing hand, but in that case the existing cards would have to be replaced and not added to. So we first cache the players existing hand, then create the new hand, and finally return the cached hand to the deck. The net effect of this is that the player will not have any of his previous cards in the new hand.

        Parameters:
        playerNum - the integer reference to the player who will "own" the new hand.
        numCardsInHand - the number of cards to be in the new hand.
        Returns:
        a List of cards constituting the new hand.

      • returnHandFromOwner

        public void returnHandFromOwner(int oldOwner,
                                int newOwner)
        Intended for use in returning a player's hand to the deck (when newOwner == 0) but can also be used to change the owner of a hand to a new, arbitrary owner.
        Parameters:
        oldOwner - the owner of the cards whose ownership is being changed.
        newOwner - the new owner of the designated cards.

      • buildCardAsJSON

        public java.lang.String buildCardAsJSON(Card card,
                                        java.lang.String path)
        Create a JSON string describing a single Card.
        Parameters:

        path - the URL path where the Deck.Face images can be found.
        Returns:
        the JSON string

        Creates a JSON string describing a hand of cards.
